titleStmt.title: A testimony wherein is shewed certain weighty reasons why the national ministers, their way and practice, is conscientiously disowned, and their maintenance by tythes or other hire denyed also, a testimony, from a certain experience, to the people called Presbyterians, and all that are zealous in their way : also, a testimony to them called Anabaptists, with some reflections upon a book (propogated among them), called The child's instructor, .../ by a sufferer for the testimony of truth against deceit, and the antichristian oppression of tythes ... Sebastion Ellythorp.
titleStmt.author: Ellythorp, Sebastian, d. 1695.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed and sold by T. Sowle ...,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.
